head.title: Man Dies in 5th Ave. Restaurant Shootout

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Man Dies in 5th Ave. Restaurant Shootout

block.p: A man was shot to death outside a Chinese restaurant in midtown Manhattan Saturday evening and another man was seriously injured in an incident that possibly involved Asian gang activity, the police said yesterday.

The shooting grew out of a gathering of about a dozen men on the second floor of the Hunan Fifth Avenue Restaurant at 323 Fifth Avenue near 32d Street, an area frequented by tourists a few blocks south of the Empire State Building, the police said.

A man was shot to death outside a Chinese restaurant in midtown Manhattan Saturday evening and another man was seriously injured in an incident that possibly involved Asian gang activity, the police said yesterday.

The shooting grew out of a gathering of about a dozen men on the second floor of the Hunan Fifth Avenue Restaurant at 323 Fifth Avenue near 32d Street, an area frequented by tourists a few blocks south of the Empire State Building, the police said.

As the men ran from the building, one dressed in black shot another man who fell to the sidewalk, mortally wounded. The police later found a second man, lying unconscious on the second floor, with a head wound, possibly caused by a blow from a blunt object.
Yesterday, investigators were still trying to identify the victims and seeking information about what prompted the dispute.
"As things are now, they're investigating the possibility it's gang-related," said a police spokesman, Sgt. Nicholas Vreeland.
At about 6:15 P.M., about 8 to 10 men entered the restaurant and requested a table on the second floor, where they were joined soon after by two other men.
Suddenly, restaurant employees heard a disturbance upstairs followed by gunfire. The men ran from the building out onto Fifth Avenue. Outside, one shot another twice.

When police officers from the Manhattan South Precinct responded to a call of a man shot, they found the victim lying on the sidewalk, face up, with a fully loaded, .22-caliber semiautomatic pistol in his hand, Sergeant Vreeland said.

Lucy Janowska, a waitress from Brook's Coffee Shop at 330 Fifth Avenue, said: "We went outside and this guy was down on the street. A young guy, teen-ager or early 20's, with a gun at his side. He didn't have any shoes on."
Moments before, said another waitress, Joanne Nunez, a man had come bursting into the coffee shop, yelling for them to call the police.
"Somebody got shot across the street," she recalled him saying.
Then, she added, "Two Chinese guys came out of the restaurant wearing black leather jackets and jeans.
"They ran to 32d Street toward Sixth Avenue. Then the owner came outside and tried to get people to go away."

The police found another gun, a .357-magnum Taurus revolver lying on the floor inside the Fifth Avenue foyer of the restaurant, and, at the service entrance of the restaurant, another handgun, a .357-magnum Smith & Wesson.

Upstairs, they found a second unidentified victim, lying unconscious on the floor, with a head wound. He was taken to St. Vincent's Hospital, where he was listed in critical condition last night, said a spokeswoman, Dina Gabriel.
